page.title: 02Landscape and Buildings
page.content:
Landscape
The land is flat and close to sea level. The scenery immediately apparent is lines of irregularly spaced willow growing along field boundaries, and of long grassy droveways reaching through to distant fields. The exposed position allows the prevailing westerly wind to sweep unchecked across the fen, touched only by a few trees, thorn hedge and high grass banks of the lodes. In winter the fen is bleak and raw, in summer it has a softer, peaceful air.
Buildings
The few isolated brick buildings originate from local claypits in the 19th century. Newer buildings are mainly postwar family extensions.
